taxon_identification.taxon_hierarchy: family asteraceae;tribe heliantheae;subtribe rudbeckiinae;genus rudbeckia;section rudbeckia;species fulgida;variety speciosa

bio:treatment.description: Stems glabrous or sparsely villous-hirsute (hairs spreading). Leaves: basal blades broadly lanceolate to ovate, 2–6.5 cm wide, lengths to 2 times widths, bases mostly rounded, margins entire or crenate, faces sparsely to moderately hairy; cauline petiolate (proximal) or ± sessile (distal), elliptic to lanceolate (becoming somewhat panduriform distally), not notably smaller distally, bases cuneate, attenuate, or auriculate, margins coarsely serrate to lacerate, faces scabrous to strigose. Phyllaries reflexed, 1–2.2 × 0.2–0.7 cm, glabrous or sparsely hairy. Receptacles 11–18 mm diam.; palea margins ciliate, faces glabrous. Ray florets 12–21; laminae 20–40 mm. 2n = ca. 76.
Ont., Que.; Ala., Ark., Conn., Del., Ga., Ill., Ky., Mass., Mich., Mo., N.J., N.Y., Ohio, Pa., Va., W.Va., Wis.
bio:treatment.discussion: Variety speciosa has rarely been introduced in Canada.
